snippet: The state's highest court upheld surrogate-motherhood contracts today, ruling that a woman who bore a baby for a childless couple had no parental rights.   Lawyers in the case said it was the first ruling by any state supreme court to uphold such ...
lead_paragraph: The state's highest court upheld surrogate-motherhood contracts today, ruling that a woman who bore a baby for a childless couple had no parental rights. Lawyers in the case said it was the first ruling by any state supreme court to uphold such contracts. In the most famous ruling involving surrogacy, in the so-called Baby M case, the New Jersey Supreme Court declared such contracts invalid.

headline.main: Parental Rights Denied To a Surrogate Mother
